clobber.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to affect or punish someone or something badly, especially by making them lose money
clobber.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The paper got clobbered for libel.
The company has been clobbered by falling property prices.
clobber.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to defeat someone very easily in a way that is embarrassing for the team that loses
clobber.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The Dallas Cowboys clobbered the Buffalo Bills last night.
